holidays.name: Lost Sock Memorial Day
holidays.description: A day to mourn and celebrate those single lonely socks lost forever in the laundry abyss.
holidays.origin: Originated unofficially among laundry enthusiasts and the internet community to humorously acknowledge the mystery of disappearing socks.
holidays.funFact: It's estimated that Americans lose about 1.3 billion socks per year ‚Äì now you know where they all go!

holidays.name: National Butterscotch Brownie Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the gooey, sweet, buttery joy of butterscotch brownies! A decadent twist on the classic chocolate brownie.
holidays.origin: Created by dessert lovers eager to highlight the deliciousness of butterscotch desserts.
holidays.funFact: Butterscotch actually originates from Scotland in the 19th century and was originally a candy, not a flavoring.

holidays.name: Apple Pie Day (UK)
holidays.description: A day honoring the quintessential British favorite ‚Äì the apple pie, beloved for its flaky crust and cinnamon-spiced apple filling.
holidays.origin: Traditional British food celebration, unofficially recognized on May 9 to mark the start of apple harvesting season.
holidays.funFact: Apple pies date back to at least the 14th century, with early recipes including raisins, figs, and good spices!

holidays.name: Europe Day
holidays.description: Celebrates peace and unity in Europe, marking the anniversary of the Schuman Declaration, which proposed a new form of political cooperation in Europe in 1950.
holidays.origin: Official European Union observance promoting European integration and identity.
holidays.funFact: The Schuman Declaration laid the groundwork for what eventually became the European Union ‚Äî a unique economic and political partnership.
